intro: Tournefortia syringifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf tournefortia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters. The plant features opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are usually covered in a dense layer of fine, silvery hair, giving it its common name. Its flowers are small, clustered in panicles, and often have a yellowish or greenish hue. The plant is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or arid environments.
